text: The National Expert Commission of Ukraine on the Protection of Public Morality () was a state body that from late 2004 till early 2015 operated to evaluate media to check they observed Ukrainian morality laws, which ban inciting religious hatred, producing or disseminating pornography, and propagating alcoholism and smoking.http://m.tyzhden.ua/post/133662 The commission was disbanded by the Ukrainian parliament on 10 February 2015.http://www.radiosvoboda.mobi/a/26839747.html ==History== On 17 November 2004 the commission was established by then Prime Minister Viktor Yanukovych.http://zakon4.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/1550-2004-п In December 2010 then-President Yanukovych issued a decree to eliminate the commission.http://m.tyzhden.ua/post/71154 In August 2012, the body gained media attention in the United States and the United Kingdom for reviewing allegations that popular children's properties, such as SpongeBob SquarePants, Disney films, Shrek, and Teletubbies are inappropriate for children and need to be banned. The commission was eliminated by the Ukrainian parliament on 10 February 2015.http://www.radiosvoboda.mobi/a/26839747.html The (law that created the) body was criticised by the Kharkiv Human Rights Protection Group for being dangerously open to subjective interpretation what precisely “harms public morality”.http://khpg.org/en/index.php?id=1423052539 But it noted that the commission was never used to limit freedom of speech.http://khpg.org/en/index.php?id=1423052539 == See also == * State Committee in Television and Radio-broadcasting (Ukraine) ==References== == External links == * Official website * Ukraine’s National Expert Commission for Protecting Public Morality Sets Its Sight on SpongeBob Category:Censorship in Ukraine Category:Government of Ukraine Category:Mass media in Ukraine
title: National Expert Commission of Ukraine on the Protection of Public Morality
